property.description: The primary PDP image displayed upon initial display of the PDP.
Product Name. The primary Product Name.
Online Price. The actual price the customer will pay for this item. Could be overridden with Volume Pricing depending on the configuration.
Selectable Features. This element contains all the features that define the specific Variant for purchase. Typical examples are Color and Size.
The Qty field that the customer uses for purchasing.
Add To Cart. The actual action button that adds the Product to the cart.
Long Description. The primary description for the Product.
Distinguishing Feature. Secondary description for the Product.
A link asset that allows for a popup view of a larger image, as required.
Alternate Image, typically used to display another view of the Product upon mouse hover.
PDP Product 360 Video. Only used if there is a 360 degree Video, or similar asset available.
PDP Product Video. Only used if there is a product Video asset available.
Introduction or Discontinuation Content. Specific Page Content that may be included informing the customer that the Product is not available, either waiting to be Introduced or Discontinued.
Out of Stock Content. Specific Page Content that may be included informing the customer that the Product is not available for purchase.
In Store Only Content. Specific Page Content that may be included informing the customer that the Product is only available for in store purchase.
List Price. May be used as a display or in calculations for Savings fields.
Price Saving Percent. Compares LIST and ONLINE prices. This shows the percentage saved if the percent saved exceeds the THRESHOLD parameter.
Price Saving Money. Compares LIST and ONLINE prices. This shows the amount saved if the amount saved exceeds the THRESHOLD parameter.
Recurrence price. The price the customer will pay for this item if placed as a recurring order.
RENAME from pdpCustomerRating. Customer Rating and Review Stars. This could apply for BigFish, Reevoo or another integrated Rating and Review solution.
Offers the Read-Reviews link. Only applicable if using BigFish Reviews.
Offers the Write-A-Review link. Only applicable if using BigFish Reviews.
A Container that will display a list of all reviews posted by customers.
Add To Wishlist. The actual action button that adds the Product to the Wish List.
Volume Pricing. Products may be configured to have Volume Pricing.
Sales Pitch. Secondary description for the Product.
Special Instructions. Secondary description for the Product.
Delivery. Secondary description for the Product.
Directions. Secondary description for the Product.
Ingredients. Secondary description for the Product.
Warnings. Secondary description for the Product.
Terms and Conditions. Secondary description for the Product.
A container Tab component. Can be used as a general tab area for various content, including Product features and Descriptions.
Complement Products. A container that is further defined in pdpComplement.
Accessory Products. A container that is further defined in pdpAccessory.
Complement and Accessory product combined into a container with an outer "div".
Recently Viewed Products. A container that is further defined in pdpRecent.
Stock Legend. If applicable, a legend to indicate stock levels.
Back To Main Image. A simple link used with Video and Video360 as a way to return to the Image view.
Additional Content By Category. Display of Product level content maintained at the Category level.
Manufacturer Text, could be a description, bio, etc
Manufacturer Heading (could be Designer for example)
Product Name. The primary Product Name.
The primary PDP image displayed upon initial display of the PDP.
A link asset that allows for a popup view of a larger image, as required.
Alternate Image, typically used to display another view of the Product upon mouse hover.
PDP Product 360 Video. Only used if there is a 360 degree Video, or similar asset available.
PDP Product Video. Only used if there is a product Video asset available.
Introduction or Discontinuation Content. Specific Page Content that may be included informing the customer that the Product is not available, either waiting to be Introduced or Discontinued.
Out of Stock Content. Specific Page Content that may be included informing the customer that the Product is not available for purchase.
In Store Only Content. Specific Page Content that may be included informing the customer that the Product is only available for in store purchase.
List Price. May be used as a display or in calculations for Savings fields.
Online Price. The actual price the customer will pay for this item. Could be overridden with Volume Pricing depending on the configuration.
Price Saving Percent. Compares LIST and ONLINE prices. This shows the percentage saved if the percent saved exceeds the THRESHOLD parameter.
Price Saving Money. Compares LIST and ONLINE prices. This shows the amount saved if the amount saved exceeds the THRESHOLD parameter.
Recurrence price. The price the customer will pay for this item if placed as a recurring order.

The footprint, or temperature bar, that informs the customer which step of a multi-page check-out they are currently on
All the items that have been added to the Shopping Cart, excluding the Summary totals
Promo or Coupon Code entry element. This is where the customer enters a coupon code and may view the savings or benefits.
Loyalty Points entry element. This is where the customer enters a Loyalty Points ID and may redeem for monetary units.
The PREVIOUS button that will return the customer to the previous step.
The CONTINUE button that will return the customer to the next step.
The offer price of the item
The unit price of the item
The total (quantity * price) of the item.
The button that will update the quantity of the item.

The button that will remove the item from the cart
The items stock level (In Stock, Out of Stock , Low Stock)
The link to "Add Gift message" page
Recurrence Frequency. Drop Down of Shipping frequency for the item on Recurrence.
The footprint, or temperature bar, that informs the customer which step of a multi-page check-out they are currently on.
Prompt to enter Personal Information. Available for only guest customers
Prompt to enter or confirm the Billing Address
Prompt to enter or confirm the Shipping Address
The PREVIOUS button that will return the customer to the previous step.

Display details of the Store where items are to be picked up.
For multi-address selection, the component that will replace ShippingAddress and ShippingMethod containers
Gift Card redemption entry element. This is where the customer enters a Gift Card number and views redemption details.
Store Credit redemption entry element. This is where the customer enters a Store Credit to be applied against the balance due.
The various payment options as configured for this implementation.
In the event that a multi-step checkout was accessed via a Guest workflow, prompts to allow customer to create an account.
